definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: This movie tersely portrays the characters' personalities.
sentences.chinese: 影片洗练地刻画了人物的性格。

sentences.english: The author's laconic prose manages to be both dexterous and sinister.
sentences.chinese: 这位作者简洁的文字做到既洗练又有邪恶的暗示。

sentences.english: His style was chastened by study of great writers.
sentences.chinese: 他的文笔因研究了伟大作家的作品而变得洗练。

sentences.english: His witty , profound , terse writing style makes his literary works are with high artistic value.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品文笔俏皮，精深洗练，具有很高的艺术价值。

definition: variant of 洗練|洗练[xi3 lian4]
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to refine (a substance)/to purify/to refine (one's skills, writing etc)/refined/polished/succinct/skilled/capable
(textiles) to scour/to degum (silk)/variant of 精煉|精炼[jing1 lian4]
lit. spirit and marrow/the essential character
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
